description: A vulnerability, which was classified as problematic, has been found in JIZHICMS up to 1.7.0. Affected by this issue is some unknown functionality of the file /user/userinfo.html of the component Account Profile Page. The manipulation of the argument jifen leads to improper authorization. The attack may be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
summary: The JIZHICMS software version up to 1.7.0 has a vulnerability in the Account Profile Page component, specifically in the /user/userinfo.html file. This vulnerability allows for improper authorization through manipulation of the jifen argument, which could potentially be exploited remotely. Users of JIZHICMS are advised to update to a secure version and be cautious of any suspicious activity on their accounts.

description: A vulnerability, which was classified as problematic, was found in JIZHICMS up to 1.7.0. This affects an unknown part of the file /user/release.html of the component Article Handler. The manipulation of the argument ishot with the input 1 leads to improper authorization. It is possible to initiate the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
summary: This vulnerability in JIZHICMS up to version 1.7.0 allows unauthorized users to gain access to sensitive information through manipulation of the ishot argument in the Article Handler component. This could potentially affect any users of the software who have not updated to a secure version. To protect against this threat, users should update their JIZHICMS software to a version beyond 1.7.0.

description: A vulnerability was found in PHPGurukul Doctor Appointment Management System 1.0 and classified as critical. summary: This vulnerability in PHPGurukul Doctor Appointment Management System allows for SQL injection through a specific file. This could potentially be exploited by attackers remotely. Users of this system should update to a patched version to prevent any attacks.

Affected by this issue is some unknown functionality of the file /admin/edit-artist-detail.php?editid=1. The manipulation of the argument Name leads to sql injection. summary: This vulnerability in PHPGurukul Art Gallery Management System allows attackers to manipulate the system through SQL injection, potentially compromising sensitive data. Users of this system should update to a patched version to protect against this threat.

description: The Nested Pages WordPress plugin before 3.2.13 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as contributors to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup).
summary: The Nested Pages WordPress plugin before version 3.2.13 is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks, which could allow higher privilege users to inject malicious code into the website, even if certain security measures are in place. This could affect websites using this plugin, especially in a multisite setup. Users should update the plugin to version 3.2.13 or later to prevent potential security risks.

description: The Pods  WordPress plugin before 3.2.8.2 does not sanitize and escape a parameter before using it in a SQL statement, allowing admins to perform SQL injection attacks
summary: A vulnerability has been found in the Pods WordPress plugin that allows attackers to perform SQL injection attacks. This affects users of the plugin who have not updated to version 3.2.8.2. Users should update to the latest version of the plugin to fix this issue and prevent potential attacks.

description: Attila Szász discovered that the HFS+ file system implementation in the Linux Kernel contained a heap overflow vulnerability. An attacker could use a specially crafted file system image that, when mounted, could cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.
summary: This vulnerability in the Linux Kernel's HFS+ file system could allow attackers to crash a system or execute malicious code by using a specially crafted file system image. Users of Linux systems utilizing the HFS+ file system should update their software to the latest version to protect against this threat.

description:
Relative Path Traversal vulnerability in Apache Commons VFS before 2.10.0.

The FileObject API in Commons VFS has a 'resolveFile' method that
takes a 'scope' parameter. Specifying 'NameScope.DESCENDENT' promises that "an exception is thrown if the resolved file is not a descendent of
the base file". However, when the path contains encoded ".."
characters (for example, "%2E%2E/bar.txt"), it might return file objects that are not
a descendent of the base file, without throwing an exception.
This issue affects Apache Commons VFS: before 2.10.0.

Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.10.0, which fixes the issue.
summary: There is a security vulnerability in Apache Commons VFS versions prior to 2.10.0 related to relative path traversal. This vulnerability allows attackers to access files outside of the intended directory. Users should upgrade to version 2.10.0 to fix this issue.

description: A vulnerability, which was classified as problematic, was found in SourceCodester Online Eyewear Shop 1.0. Affected is an unknown function of the file /oews/admin/. The manipulation leads to exposure of information through directory listing. It is possible to launch the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. It is recommended to change the configuration settings. Multiple sub-directories are affected.
summary: This vulnerability in the SourceCodester Online Eyewear Shop 1.0 allows attackers to access sensitive information through directory listing. description: Versions of the package nossrf before 1.0.4 are vulnerable to Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) where an attacker can provide a hostname that resolves to a local or reserved IP address space and bypass the SSRF protection mechanism.
summary: This vulnerability in the package nossrf allows an attacker to send malicious requests from the server, potentially accessing sensitive data or services within the local network. Users of versions before 1.0.4 are affected. To mitigate this threat, users should update to version 1.0.4 or newer to prevent SSRF attacks.

description:
Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor vulnerability in Apache Commons VFS.

The FtpFileObject class can throw an exception when a file is not found, revealing the original URI in its message, which may include a password. The fix is to mask the password in the exception message
This issue affects Apache Commons VFS: before 2.10.0.

Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.10.0, which fixes the issue.
summary: The vulnerability in Apache Commons VFS allows an unauthorized actor to access sensitive information, such as passwords, through an exception message when a file is not found. This affects versions of Apache Commons VFS before 2.10.0. Users should upgrade to version 2.10.0 to fix this issue and protect their sensitive information.

description: Improper link resolution before file access ('link following') in Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) allows an authorized attacker to elevate privileges locally.
summary: This vulnerability in Microsoft Edge allows a hacker with authorized access to gain higher levels of access on a device. This could affect users of Microsoft Edge who are targeted by attackers. To protect against this, users should ensure they have the latest security updates installed on their devices.

description: No cwe for this issue in Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) allows an unauthorized attacker to execute code over a network.

summary: A critical vulnerability has been discovered in PHPGurukul Bank Locker Management System 1.0, which could allow attackers to conduct SQL injection attacks by manipulating a specific file. This vulnerability may be exploited remotely and has been publicly disclosed. Users of this system should take immediate action to update or patch the software to prevent potential attacks.

description: The Form Maker by 10Web  WordPress plugin before 1.15.30 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as admin to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup).
summary: A vulnerability in the Form Maker by 10Web WordPress plugin allows high privilege users to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks, even when certain permissions are restricted. This affects users of the plugin, particularly in multisite setups. Users should update to version 1.15.30 to patch this vulnerability.

description: The Photo Gallery by 10Web  WordPress plugin before 1.8.33 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as admin to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup).
summary: This vulnerability in the Photo Gallery by 10Web WordPress plugin allows high privilege users, like admins, to execute harmful scripts on the website. This could affect any website using the plugin, particularly in a multisite setup. Users should update to version 1.8.33 or later to protect against this threat.

description: The Slider, Gallery, and Carousel by MetaSlider  WordPress plugin before 3.95.0 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as admin to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup).
summary: The Slider, Gallery, and Carousel by MetaSlider WordPress plugin before version 3.95.0 is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks. This could allow high privilege users, like admins, to insert malicious code into the plugin settings, potentially impacting websites even when some security measures are in place. Users should update to version 3.95.0 or higher to protect against this vulnerability.
software: Slider, Gallery, and Carousel by MetaSlider

description: The Slider, Gallery, and Carousel by MetaSlider  WordPress plugin before 3.95.0 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as editor to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup).
summary: This CVE affects the Slider, Gallery, and Carousel by MetaSlider WordPress plugin prior to version 3.95.0. It allows high privilege users, like editors, to execute Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even if they do not have permission to use unfiltered_html capability. To mitigate this threat, users should update the plugin to version 3.95.0 or later.

description: A vulnerability has been found in mingyuefusu 明月复苏 tushuguanlixitong 图书管理系统 up to d4836f6b49cd0ac79a4021b15ce99ff7229d4694 and classified as critical. Affected by this vulnerability is the function doFilter of the file /admin/ of the component Backend. The manipulation of the argument Request leads to improper access controls. The attack can be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
summary: This vulnerability, found in the mingyuefusu library management system, allows remote attackers to access unauthorized information through manipulation of a specific function. It is classified as critical and affects versions up to d4836f6b49cd0ac79a4021b15ce99ff7229d4694. Users of this system should update to a secure version to protect against potential attacks.

description: A vulnerability classified as critical has been found in PHPGurukul eLearning System 1.0. Affected is an unknown function of the file /user/index.php of the component Image Handler. The manipulation leads to unrestricted upload. It is possible to launch the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
summary: This vulnerability in PHPGurukul eLearning System allows for unrestricted file uploads through the Image Handler component, which can be exploited remotely. This affects users of the system and could lead to unauthorized access or other malicious activities. Users should update to a patched version of the software to prevent exploitation.

description: A vulnerability classified as problematic was found in TOTOLINK A3000RU up to 5.9c.5185. Affected by this vulnerability is an unknown functionality of the file /cgi-bin/ExportSyslog.sh of the component Syslog Configuration File Handler. The manipulation leads to improper access controls. The attack needs to be done within the local network. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
summary: This is a vulnerability found in TOTOLINK A3000RU routers that allows for improper access controls through the manipulation of a specific file. The threat affects users within the local network. To protect against this vulnerability, users should update their router firmware to the latest version provided by TOTOLINK.

description: A vulnerability, which was classified as critical, has been found in yiisoft Yii2 up to 2.0.45. Affected by this issue is the function getIterator of the file symfony\finder\Iterator\SortableIterator.php. The manipulation leads to deserialization. The attack may be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
summary: This is a critical vulnerability found in the yiisoft Yii2 software up to version 2.0.45. It affects the getIterator function in the file SortableIterator.php, allowing for remote attackers to launch a deserialization attack. This exploit has been made public and can be used by malicious actors. Users of this software should update to a patched version to protect against this threat.

description: A vulnerability, which was classified as critical, was found in yiisoft Yii2 up to 2.0.39. This affects the function Generate of the file phpunit\src\Framework\MockObject\MockClass.php. The manipulation leads to deserialization. It is possible to initiate the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
summary: This vulnerability found in Yii2 up to version 2.0.39 allows attackers to execute code remotely through manipulation of the Yii2 framework's MockClass.php file. This poses a critical threat to users of Yii2. It is recommended that users update to a patched version of Yii2 to protect against this vulnerability.

description: A vulnerability was found in GetmeUK ContentTools up to 1.6.16. It has been rated as problematic. Affected by this issue is some unknown functionality of the component Image Handler. The manipulation of the argument onload leads to cross site scripting. The attack may be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.
summary: This vulnerability in GetmeUK ContentTools up to version 1.6.16 allows for cross-site scripting attacks through manipulation of the Image Handler component. This could be exploited remotely by attackers. Users of this software should update to a patched version or consider alternative solutions to protect against potential attacks. The vendor has been made aware of the issue but has not responded to address it.

description: A vulnerability classified as problematic has been found in michelson Dante Editor up to 0.4.4. This affects an unknown part of the component Insert Link Handler. The manipulation leads to cross site scripting. It is possible to initiate the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.
summary: This vulnerability in michelson Dante Editor allows for cross site scripting attacks, which could be initiated remotely. It affects users of the software up to version 0.4.4. To stay safe, users should update to the latest version or consider alternative software until a patch is released. It is concerning that the vendor has not responded to this issue, so users should be cautious and proactive in protecting their systems.

description: A vulnerability classified as critical was found in AMTT Hotel Broadband Operation System 1.0. This vulnerability affects the function popen of the file /manager/network/port_setup.php. The manipulation of the argument SwitchVersion/SwitchWrite/SwitchIP/SwitchIndex/SwitchState leads to os command injection. The attack can be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.
summary: This vulnerability in the AMTT Hotel Broadband Operation System allows attackers to remotely execute commands on the system by manipulating certain arguments. It is critical and affects users of this system. Users should take immediate action to mitigate this threat, as the vendor has not responded to the disclosure.

description: A vulnerability, which was classified as critical, has been found in Softwin WMX3 3.1. This issue affects the function ImageAdd of the file /ImageAdd.ashx. The manipulation of the argument File leads to unrestricted upload. The attack may be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.
summary: The Softwin WMX3 3.1 software has a critical vulnerability that allows for unrestricted upload and remote attacks. This affects anyone using this software. Users should be aware of this threat and take precautions to protect their systems, such as updating to a secure version of the software or implementing other security measures.
